intro: Pseudolappula, commonly known as the false lappula, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are annual or biennial herbs. The plants typically have hairy stems and alternate leaves that are usually ovate or lanceolate in shape. Their small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the summer months. Pseudolappula species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
